Pure library reference

Pure Library is a collection of different packages and classes, that can be used in Java projects. This library is based on Java JRE only and doesn't use any third-party libraries. It was one of the main goals when this library was developing. In the most of cases, it's classes are oriented to maximal performance, so many of them have an old-styled program code. They also oriented to use standard Java mechanisms, protocols and so on...

Library content

0.0.3 what's new
0.0.2 what's new

chav1961.purelib.basic package

This package contains classes to simplify quick parsers development and to simplify development of the console-oriented stand-alone applications. It contains a 'pluggable' class loader to implement easy-to-use plugin mechanism in your applications, a class, that simplified processing of the console commands (it parses console command according to it's syntax, finds appropriative command processor and execute it), a set of logger facades (because of the ZOO of the logger projects, that is a real problem now). It also contains 'smart' Property class, that supports property substitutions and automatic data type conversions, some classes that can be used in quick parsers (including quick tree to manipulate lexemas and names) Ñ‹and quick character reader for line-by-line data processing. A special utility class supports some usable functions in the programming practice.

chav1961.purelib.concurrent package

This package contains some useful classes to use in the concurrent programming

chav1961.purelib.growablearrays package

This package supports a set of growable arrays to use in the quick parsers and other tasks. It usability is specialized on the well-known task: quick filling of the array's content with the data and longer using them as 'constant' data. Since 0.0.2, they also supports dynamic growing/shrinking and can be used an general resizable arrays. Differ to List functionality, growable arrays supports only primitive types without any wrapping.

chav1961.purelib.fsys package

This package supports a 'File system' abstractions for the different kings of it's 'substrate'. This concept is similar to File system concept in the Java 1.7, but extends it to the wide range of data stores: files and file systems, RMI connections, URL-based connections, database content and so on. In the extension of the pure library you can find a lot of the additional 'file system' implementations. File systems also supports Linux-styled mounting, that allow you to make heterogenous file system tree to use it in your program.

chav1961.purelib.i18n package

This package supports concept of the multilingual strings.

chav1961.purelib.streams package

This package supports Java I/O concept of the streams. The 'root' package contains class, that supports stream parsing of the JSON content by XML SAX style. It also contains utility class to build JSON SAX-style handlers for quick-and-simple deserialization JSON content into Java classes

Subpackages of this package contain different kind of the streams-convertors. Main idea of them is to make on-the-fly conversion from data written from one format to another. All the streams are 'ordinal' I/O streams and don't require a special case to use. Subpackages contain a markdown-->HTML converotr, Creole-->HTML convertor, and also Java bytecode Assembler, that converts assembly byte code to byte[], containing class description for use with defineClass(String,byte[],int,int) method

0.0.3 what's new

0.0.2 what's new

Generally

To unify checking rules for method's parameters, a more specific NullPointerException, ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException are used now instead of IllegalArgumentException in the method's parameters checking code. A new package chav1961.purelib.basic.xsd package was created to keep and allow access with the different XSD schemes in the Pure Library. Package chav1961.purelib.i18n was fully refactored. Also some bugs detected were fixed

chav1961.purelib.basic package

Some useful classes were added to the package:

  • PureLibSettings class to support global settings for Pure Library classes. This settings can be controlled with the -Dpurelib.settings.source variable on the JVM starting
  • ReusableInstances class to support C/C++ malloc()/free() programming style to reuse allocated instances of the class
  • FSM and StackedFSM classes to support finite state machine's functionality in the Java applications
  • AssemblerTemplateRepo class to use with the AsmWriter class to support assembler code automation
  • AbstractScriptEngineFactory and AbstractScriptEngine classes to use with the Java scripting mechanism
  • AsmScriptEngineFactory class to support using Java byte code assembler via the Java scripting mechanism

chav1961.purelib.basic.growablearrays package

As a result of practical using of this package, some changes were made in it:

  • a new useful method length(int) was added to all classes in the package
  • a deep refactoring of all the classes was made to support growing/shrinking of the array content and increase it's performance
  • GrowableByteArray class extended it's functionality with the OutputStream and DataInputStream
  • GrowableCharArray class extended it's functionality with the Reader and Writer
  • a new InOutGrowableByteArray class was added to extend GrowableByteArray functionality with the DataOutputStream and DataInputStream methods

All the classes in the package can be used now as fast resizable arrays of primitive types.

chav1961.purelib.fsys package

  • an implementation of URLStreamHandler (named FileSystemURLStreamHandler) was added to support access to the file systems abilities thru URL mechanism
  • some bugs were fixed
Modules 
Module Description
chav1961.purelib
This module contains Pure Library project content.
